body_html:
We have a decent amount of API endpoints, with a minimal amount of documentation around them. AFAIK the only existing documentation is at http://normandy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev/self-repair.html for the self-repair related APIs.

@chartjes brought up documenting our API with Swagger (apparently we have some tooling that can consume this somewhere), which is a good idea. @jvehent also mentioned it during a Hawaii talk. DRF supports documenting APIs in a format-agnostic way, which can then be output in various formats, including Swagger: http://www.django-rest-framework.org/api-guide/schemas/#schemas

We should do that. While doing that, we should get rid of the self-repair docs, as they're confusing right now IMO.
title: Document API with Swagger
